title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Judge ruled Shannon O’Brien was wrongfully removed as chair of Massachusetts Cannabis Control Commission, ordered her reinstatement.
State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg, via Attorney General Andrea Campbell, filed an appeal, successfully delaying O'Brien's reinstatement for a week.
O'Brien’s term as commission chair is set to expire on August 31, 2027; response to the state's appeal is due Wednesday.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A 38-year-old woman was found dead on Newhall Street in Lynn early Sunday morning.
A 30-year-old Lynn man has been charged with murder and is set to be arraigned on Monday.
Essex County DA Paul Tucker announced the case, withholding both the victim's and suspect's names for now.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers expressed contentment with the Las Vegas Raiders after his recent trade request was denied by the team.
Meyers, in the final year of his contract, seeks a new deal as negotiations with the Raiders have stalled.
During the Raiders' 20-13 win in Foxborough, Meyers caught eight passes for 97 yards, calling it a homecoming.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A radar-confirmed tornado touched down near Worcester, Massachusetts, with the National Weather Service confirming it in Holden.
Severe thunderstorms affected much of the East Coast, with tornado warnings around Worcester, Springfield, and Marlborough.
Damage included fallen trees and power outages in communities like Paxton and Holyoke, but no reported injuries.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots lost their opener to the Raiders 20-13, plagued by familiar issues despite offseason changes.
Quarterback Drake Maye showed promise early, but faltered with turnovers and inefficiency in the second half.
Patriots' new defensive additions showed potential, but struggled to contain Raiders' big plays, resulting in 362 passing yards.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie Will Campbell had a strong NFL debut for the Patriots, holding his own for three quarters against the Raiders.
Campbell struggled late, allowing two sacks and committing two false start penalties in the second half of the game.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel emphasized the need for improvement across the team, including rookie Campbell and quarterback Drake Maye.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer is on leave after appearing incapacitated during a traffic stop, as seen in a viral video.
The officer's behavior, including not responding and stumbling, led to accusations of substance use by a bystander.
Lynn police state the officer likely experienced a medical episode, with an investigation currently underway.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Harold Landry III excelled with 2.5 sacks for the Patriots, showcasing strong defensive capabilities in the game against the Raiders.
Drake Maye finished with 287 passing yards but threw a crucial interception, impacting the Patriots' performance in the 20-13 loss.
Patriots' running backs struggled, accumulating only 60 yards on 18 carries; TreVeyon Henderson led with 27 yards on five touches.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys performed at Suffolk Downs despite a two-hour rain delay during the Seisiún festival in Boston.
Stiff Little Fingers' performance was canceled, but attendees saw Dropkick Murphys and The Hold Steady.
The band, led by Ken Casey, energized a reduced crowd with songs like "The Boys Are Back" and "I'm Shipping Up To Boston."

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices, citing a lack of welcome at the Patriots' facilities.
The ban is part of ongoing tensions between Belichick and the Patriots, following his departure in 2023.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel downplayed the ban, emphasizing focus on the team and alternative scouting methods.
